Description: Fragment of East Greek pottery bowl, with part of horizontal rim; bands on underside; on top of rim, meander frieze; at top of wall between bands lotus and bud frieze; added red and white on the bands and added red on the bud.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 27, no. 93 pl. 26)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.152)
